workflow.name: Monitoring team capacity in Jira and sending alerts for over-allocation
workflow.description:
## Description:
This workflow automates team capacity monitoring using Jira data to identify over-allocated team members and alert managers instantly. It ensures proactive workload management by fetching active issues, calculating utilization rates, logging capacity metrics, and sending detailed email alerts when members exceed 100% capacity.
It helps project managers prevent burnout, balance workloads, and maintain operational efficiency ‚Äî all with zero manual tracking.

## What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

üü¢ Manual Trigger ‚Äì Start the capacity analysis manually on demand.

üìã Fetch Active Jira Issues ‚Äì Retrieves all ‚ÄúIn Progress‚Äù tasks from Jira to analyze workloads.

‚úÖ Data Validation ‚Äì Checks whether Jira returned valid data before continuing.
True Path: Moves to capacity calculation.
False Path: Logs query failure to error tracking sheet.

üìä Capacity Calculator ‚Äì Aggregates logged hours per user and calculates utilization percentage based on an 8-hour daily capacity.

üìà Log Capacity Data to Tracking Sheet ‚Äì Appends capacity metrics (Assignee, Total Hours, Utilization %, Status) to a Google Sheet for historical tracking and trend analysis.

‚ö†Ô∏è Over-Allocation Check ‚Äì Identifies team members exceeding 100% utilization (status = ‚ÄúOverallocated‚Äù).

üì¢ Alert Report Generator ‚Äì Builds a dynamic report summarizing all over-allocated members, their logged hours, utilization %, and corrective suggestions.
Generates both alert and ‚ÄúAll Clear‚Äù reports based on findings.

üìß Send Over-Allocation Alert to Manager ‚Äì Sends an automated Gmail alert to the project manager, including severity-based subject lines and detailed breakdown of each over-allocated member.

üö® Log Query Failures to Error Sheet ‚Äì Records any Jira API or data retrieval issues in the ‚Äúerror log sheet‚Äù for monitoring and debugging.

## Prerequisites
- Jira account with API access
- Google Sheets for ‚ÄúTeam Capacity Tracking‚Äù and ‚ÄúError Log‚Äù
- Gmail credentials for automated email delivery

## Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Early detection of team over-allocation
 ‚úÖ Automated data logging and historical tracking
 ‚úÖ Real-time email alerts to prevent burnout
 ‚úÖ Data-driven sprint planning and workload balancing
 ‚úÖ Zero manual monitoring required

## Perfect For
- Project Managers and Scrum Masters tracking team load
- Engineering teams managing multiple active sprints
- Organizations looking to automate workload visibility
- HR and PMOs monitoring resource utilization trends

parameters.content:
## üìß Send Over-Allocation Alert to Manager
**Action:**  
- Delivers urgent capacity alert email to project manager/team lead.  
**Description:**  
- Sends formatted alert to manager with full report details.  
- Subject line dynamically reflects severity (number of over-allocated members).  
- Message body includes:  
  - Clear warning indicators  
  - Detailed breakdown of each over-allocated team member  
  - Recommended corrective actions  
  - Generation timestamp for reference  
- Enables immediate intervention to prevent team burnout.  
- Creates email paper trail for resource allocation decisions.

## üì¢ Generate Over-Allocation Alert Report
**Action:**  
- Creates comprehensive alert message for over-allocated team members.  
**Description:**  
- Aggregates all over-allocation cases into single consolidated report.  
- Formats message with:  
  - Warning header with emoji indicators  
  - List of affected team members with hours and percentages  
  - Actionable recommendations for workload rebalancing  
  - Timestamp for tracking and audit purposes  
- Generates dynamic subject line with count of affected members.  
- Handles edge case where no over-allocations exist (all-clear message).  
- Prepares both summary and detailed data for notification delivery.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Detect Over-Allocated Team Members
**Action:**  
- Filters team members whose utilization exceeds 100% capacity.  
**Description:**  
- Evaluates status field to identify "Overallocated" team members.  
- **True Path:** Routes overloaded members to alert generation.  
- **False Path:** Skips notification if all team members are within capacity.  
- Critical decision point for proactive workload management.  
- Prevents burnout by flagging capacity issues early.

## üìà Log Capacity Data to Tracking Sheet
**Action:**  
- Records team member utilization metrics to Google Sheets for historical tracking.  
**Description:**  
- Appends each team member's capacity data to "Team Capacity Tracking" sheet.  
- Columns logged: Assignee, Total Hours, Utilization %, Status, Timestamp.  
- Creates time-series data for trend analysis and capacity planning.  
- Enables visualization of workload patterns over sprints.  
- Provides audit trail for retrospectives and resource allocation decisions.  
- Supports data-driven sprint planning and burnout prevention.

## üìä Calculate Team Member Utilization
**Action:**  
- Aggregates time logged per team member and calculates capacity utilization.  
**Description:**  
- Processes all Jira issues to extract time spent data for each assignee.  
- Converts time tracking from seconds to hours for readability.  
- Calculates utilization percentage against 8-hour daily capacity baseline.  
- Identifies over-allocated team members (>100% capacity).  
- Outputs structured data for each team member:  
  - Assignee name  
  - Total hours logged  
  - Utilization percentage  
  - Status flag (OK / Overallocated)  
- Handles unassigned tasks gracefully with "Unassigned" label

## üìä Log Query Failures to Error Sheet
**Action:**  
- Records Jira query failures or data retrieval errors to tracking spreadsheet.  
**Description:**  
- Appends error details to "error log sheet" when Jira returns no data.  
- Captures API failures, authentication issues, or JQL syntax errors.  
- Ensures no silent failures‚Äîevery execution is documented.  
- Creates queryable database for troubleshooting integration issues.  
- Helps identify patterns in API reliability or configuration problems.  
- Critical for maintaining workflow reliability and SLA monitoring.

## ‚úÖ Validate Issues Retrieved Successfully
**Action:**  
- Checks if Jira returned any active issues for processing.  
**Description:**  
- Verifies that the query successfully retrieved issue data.  
- **True Path:** Proceeds to capacity calculation when issues exist.  
- **False Path:** Routes to error logging if no data returned or query failed.  
- Prevents downstream processing errors from empty datasets.  
- Acts as a quality gate before expensive calculations.

## üìã Fetch Active Jira Issues
**Action:**  
- Retrieves all in-progress Jira issues from the project.  
**Description:**  
- Queries Jira using JQL: "statusCategory != Done AND status = 'In Progress'".  
- Pulls complete issue data including assignee, time tracking, and status.  
- Captures current workload snapshot for capacity calculations.  
- Returns all active tasks across all team members for comprehensive analysis.  
- Essential data source for utilization metrics and over-allocation detection.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
